sub_title: International and Asian affairs specialist, double M.A.
summary:
I am an Asianist and International Relations specialist with expertise in navigating the intricate political landscape and rich cultural diversity of the world, with a specific focus on East-Asian cooperation with the EU and US. As a bridge builder, I excel in forging connections between individuals and organizations, and effectively conveying complex ideas that facilitate mutual understanding.

Throughout my academic and professional journey, I have been driven by a curiosity for unraveling the interconnectedness of various aspects in our local v.s. global environment. I am dedicated to contributing to innovative solutions and gaining a holistic understanding of how different elements interconnect and shape our world.

With an unwavering commitment to excellence, I approach every endeavor with determination, ensuring that I see projects through to successful completion. I thrive in challenging environments and embrace opportunities for personal and professional growth.

Let's connect and explore new possibilities in the realm of Asian studies, international relations, and beyond.

company.name: Daniel K. Inouye Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies

profile_positions.company: Daniel K. Inouye Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies
profile_positions.description:
At DKI APCSS, I immerse myself in an environment dedicated to empowering security practitioners across the Asia-Pacific region. As part of the Regional Security Studies Intern Program, my responsibilities span a range of pivotal tasks within the institution.

Key Contributions & Learnings:

1. Seminar Support: I play an instrumental role in the successful execution of on-island courses, assisting esteemed professors in seminar facilitation, lesson planning, and actively participating in lectures and policy dialogues.

2. Collaborative Research: I engage in rigorous research initiatives, collaborating directly with DKI APCSS's dedicated faculty and staff, enriching my understanding of security dynamics.

3. Diplomatic Engagement: I have the invaluable opportunity to engage with visiting U.S. officials and foreign dignitaries, offering insights into the intricacies of global diplomatic and security relations.

4. Cultural Acumen: Beyond academic and professional endeavors, I embrace the vibrant culture and history of O'ahu, deepening my appreciation for the region.

This experience at DKI APCSS is foundational in my journey, providing a practical lens to the intricate world of international security studies and geopolitics.
profile_positions.title: Regional Security Studies Intern

profile_positions.company: Daniel K. Inouye Asia Pacific Center for Security Studies
profile_positions.description:
Currently participating in the Comprehensive Security Cooperation (CSC) program, an intensive 5-week in-resident executive course designed for mid-level professionals intersecting with the security realm, all while concurrently undertaking an internship at DKI APCSS.

Key Highlights & Learnings:

1. Transdisciplinary Collaboration: Engaging in dynamic interactions with fellow security professionals to foster mutual understanding and robust network building.
  
2. Analytical Acumen: Participating in critical thinking sessions that emphasize the importance of objective evaluation and provide tools for deciphering complex security challenges.
   
3. Geostrategic Insights: Gaining insights into regional security architectures and challenges spanning Northeast Asia, Southeast Asia, South Asia, and Oceania, complemented by an understanding of the U.S. Indo-Pacific Strategy.
   
4. In-depth Exploration: Delving into multifaceted security challenges, including maritime security, counterterrorism, environmental security, health security, and the dynamics of media misinformation.
   
5. Capacity Enhancement: Acquiring strategic-level knowledge in areas like statecraft, interagency cooperation, crisis management, and the integration of women in peace and security initiatives.
   
6. Strategic Exercises: Participating in table-top exercises to further comprehend cooperation and competition dynamics between states in real-world contexts.

Throughout the program, I am consistently broadening my understanding, evaluating security paradigms, and working on devising resilient solutions to tangible organizational and regional security challenges. This concurrent experience of interning and participating as a fellow is enhancing my perspective, equipping me to contribute more effectively to the overarching goals of promoting freedom, openness, stability, prosperity, and security in the Indo-Pacific region.
profile_positions.title: Fellow

profile_positions.description:
At the Directorate of International Affairs for the Municipality of The Hague, I found myself uniquely positioned at the crossroads of local governance and global aspirations. The Hague, often celebrated as the "City of Peace and Justice," hosts an array of prestigious international institutions like the International Court of Justice and the International Criminal Court. In this intricate landscape, my role was multifaceted.

Drawing upon my expertise in international relations, especially in the East-Asian context, I offered valuable insights and advice to my colleagues, while also fostering synergies with other governmental entities both at the provincial and national levels. Furthermore, I engaged with a variety of international stakeholders based locally, ensuring their perspectives were integrated into our initiatives.

Among the diverse projects I contributed to, my supportive role in The Hague Justice Week stands out. In collaboration with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, I assisted in the event's organization and ensured its smooth execution through adept stage and event management. Moreover, I played an instrumental role in HagueTalks, lending my organizational and stage management expertise to this dynamic platform where global discussions around peace and justice come alive.

My involvement in these initiatives exemplified my dedication to upholding The Hague's esteemed position as an epicenter for diplomacy, justice, and international collaboration.
profile_positions.title: International Affairs Officer
